com.facebook.battery.metrics.appwakeup

Class AppWakeupMetricsCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.battery.metrics.api.SystemMetricsCollector<AppWakeupMetrics>
      • com.facebook.battery.metrics.appwakeup.AppWakeupMetricsCollector

  • public class AppWakeupMetricsCollector
extends SystemMetricsCollector<AppWakeupMetrics>
    This class is used to record and aggregate the wakeups in the app. It exposes methods to record start recordWakeupStart(AppWakeupMetrics.WakeupReason, String) and end recordWakeupEnd(String) of a wakeup

      Note that access to snapshot instances is not synchronized and must be taken care of by the caller requesting getSnapshot.
      void recordWakeupEnd(java.lang.String id)
      Record the end of a wakeup.
      void recordWakeupStart(AppWakeupMetrics.WakeupReason reason, java.lang.String id)

      • getSnapshot

        public boolean getSnapshot(AppWakeupMetrics snapshot)
        Description copied from class: SystemMetricsCollector
        Note that access to snapshot instances is not synchronized and must be taken care of by the caller requesting getSnapshot.
        Specified by:
        getSnapshot in class SystemMetricsCollector<AppWakeupMetrics>
        Parameters:
        snapshot - snapshot on which the data will be written
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot has been updated with valid data.

      • createMetrics

        public AppWakeupMetrics createMetrics()
        Description copied from class: SystemMetricsCollector
        Creates an empty instance of the corresponding system metrics.

        Explicitly having this function available reduces a significant amount of boilerplate

        Specified by:
        createMetrics in class SystemMetricsCollector<AppWakeupMetrics>
        Returns:
        New System Metrics object

      • recordWakeupStart

        public void recordWakeupStart(AppWakeupMetrics.WakeupReason reason,
                              java.lang.String id)
        Record the start of a wakeup. If this method is called twice without calling recordWakeupEnd in between, we ignore the second recordWakeupStart call.
        Parameters:
        reason - One of the wakeup types defined in WakeupReason
        id - Identifier of the wakeup

      • recordWakeupEnd

        public void recordWakeupEnd(java.lang.String id)
        Record the end of a wakeup. If this method is called without calling a corresponding recordWakeupStart, then we do nothing.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the wakeup
